storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive immediate conflict detection when creating a schedule to avoid double-booking resources

testCases.title: Validate immediate conflict detection on overlapping schedule creation
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role permissions
Scheduling database is accessible and populated with existing schedules
At least one resource is already booked for a specific date and time slot

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation form is displayed with fields for date, time, and resource selection

steps.action: Select a date from the date picker that has existing bookings
steps.expectedResult: Date is selected and displayed in the date field

steps.action: Enter a start time that overlaps with an existing booking (e.g., 10:00 AM when 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM is already booked)
steps.expectedResult: Time is entered in the start time field

steps.action: Enter an end time for the schedule (e.g., 12:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Time is entered in the end time field

steps.action: Select a resource from the dropdown that is already booked for the selected time slot
steps.expectedResult: System immediately displays a conflict alert message indicating the resource is already booked with specific conflict details (existing booking time and resource name)

steps.action: Attempt to click the 'Save' or 'Submit' button to save the schedule
steps.expectedResult: System blocks the submission, keeps the Save button disabled or shows an error message, and displays clear conflict details including the conflicting schedule information

steps.action: Review the conflict details displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details clearly show the resource name, conflicting date, conflicting time range, and any additional relevant information

postconditions: Schedule is not saved to the database
Conflict alert remains visible on screen
User remains on the schedule creation page
System is ready for user to modify the schedule

testCases.title: Verify conflict detection response time under 1 second
preconditions: Performance testing environment is set up
User is logged in with Scheduler role permissions
Scheduling database contains representative test data
Performance monitoring tools are configured and running
System logs are enabled and accessible
Load testing tool is configured for concurrent user simulation
Baseline system performance metrics are recorded

steps.action: Open the schedule creation interface and prepare to create a schedule with overlapping resource
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation form is displayed and ready for input

steps.action: Start performance timer and enter date, time, and resource that conflicts with an existing booking
steps.expectedResult: All fields are populated with conflicting schedule data

steps.action: Observe and measure the time from last input field completion to conflict alert display
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert is displayed within 1 second of completing the resource selection

steps.action: Record the response time from performance monitoring tool
steps.expectedResult: Response time is logged and shows value less than or equal to 1000 milliseconds

steps.action: Configure load testing tool to simulate 1000 concurrent users attempting to create overlapping schedules
steps.expectedResult: Load testing tool is configured with 1000 virtual users ready to execute

steps.action: Execute the load test with all 1000 concurrent users creating conflicting schedules simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: Load test runs successfully with all 1000 users executing schedule creation attempts

steps.action: Monitor and collect response times for all conflict detection operations during the load test
steps.expectedResult: All conflict detections are processed and response times are recorded for each user

steps.action: Analyze the collected response time data to verify all responses are within 1 second SLA
steps.expectedResult: 95th percentile response time is at or below 1 second, meeting the performance SLA criteria

steps.action: Access system logs and filter for conflict detection API calls during the test period
steps.expectedResult: System logs display all conflict detection requests with timestamps

steps.action: Verify response times in system logs match the performance criteria (under 1 second)
steps.expectedResult: Log entries confirm response times meet performance criteria with timestamps showing sub-second processing

postconditions: Performance test data is saved for analysis
System logs contain complete performance metrics
System returns to normal operational state
No schedules from the test are persisted in the database
Performance baseline is updated if needed

testCases.title: Ensure system supports multiple resource types in conflict detection
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role permissions
Multiple resource types are configured in the system (e.g., rooms, equipment, personnel)
Scheduling database contains existing bookings for different resource types
Schedule creation interface supports all resource types
At least one resource of each type has existing bookings

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation form is displayed with resource type selection available

steps.action: Select 'Room' as the resource type from the resource type dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Resource type is set to 'Room' and available rooms are displayed in the resource dropdown

steps.action: Enter date and time that conflicts with an existing room booking, then select the conflicting room resource
steps.expectedResult: System immediately displays conflict alert for the room resource with specific conflict details

steps.action: Clear the form and select 'Equipment' as the resource type
steps.expectedResult: Form is cleared, resource type is set to 'Equipment', and available equipment items are displayed

steps.action: Enter date and time that conflicts with an existing equipment booking, then select the conflicting equipment resource
steps.expectedResult: System immediately displays conflict alert for the equipment resource with specific conflict details

steps.action: Clear the form and select 'Personnel' as the resource type
steps.expectedResult: Form is cleared, resource type is set to 'Personnel', and available personnel are displayed

steps.action: Enter date and time that conflicts with an existing personnel booking, then select the conflicting personnel resource
steps.expectedResult: System immediately displays conflict alert for the personnel resource with specific conflict details

steps.action: Clear the form and select 'Room' resource type again
steps.expectedResult: Form is cleared and ready for new room schedule input

steps.action: Enter date, time, and select a room resource that does NOT conflict with any existing bookings
steps.expectedResult: No conflict alert is displayed, form remains in valid state, and Save button is enabled

steps.action: Repeat step 9 for 'Equipment' resource type with non-conflicting schedule
steps.expectedResult: No conflict alert is displayed for equipment, form is valid, and Save button is enabled

steps.action: Repeat step 9 for 'Personnel' resource type with non-conflicting schedule
steps.expectedResult: No conflict alert is displayed for personnel, form is valid, and Save button is enabled

steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to save the valid non-conflicting personnel schedule
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate back to schedule creation and create another non-conflicting schedule for a room resource
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation form is displayed and ready for input

steps.action: Enter valid non-conflicting room schedule details and click 'Save'
steps.expectedResult: Room schedule is saved successfully with confirmation message displayed

steps.action: Create a third non-conflicting schedule for an equipment resource and save
steps.expectedResult: Equipment schedule is saved successfully with confirmation message, all three schedules for different resource types are now in the system

postconditions: Three valid schedules are saved in the database (one for each resource type)
No conflicts exist in the scheduling system
All resource types have been validated for conflict detection capability
System is ready for additional schedule creation
Confirmation messages have been displayed for all successful saves
